intro: Eutoca gracilis, commonly known as the slender eutoca, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid, shaded environments. Eutoca gracilis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate floral display.
